Choices:  A: indiana B: england C: outside D: on the wall E: picture<n><n>### Response:		Choices: E<n><n>### Input<n>He was in a cabin at the woods, through the windows he saw a fox on the ground where the candy bars and cookies were.<n><n>### Response<n>Choices: A, B, C, D, E<n><n>### Instructions: Answer each short answer question.<n><n>## Instructions: Answer the following short answer question.<n>| Instruction:How do you calculate the average number of candies (without having to find the exact number per person)?\<n>| Answer: Add up the total amount of candy and then divide it by how many people have the same amount then add them all together<n><n>## Instruktion: Which of these choices, when combined, equals (or is equal to) 6? Choices: (a) (b) -(c) (d) 3-(-5)(e) 5+(-5)<n><n>## Instrucsions: Evaluate the expressions below. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>### Input:When would you be able to see your reflection in a piece of wood? Choices:  A: burned B: polished C: carved D: composted E: nailed<n><n>### Response:		D: carved<n><n>A carved piece of wood will have no reflection because there will be no flat, smooth surface for the light to bounce off of. So, the answer is "Carved".<n><n>### Input<n>Michael has 5/7 as many cannolis as Tina has. After he eats one of them, he has 6/7 times as many cannolis left as Tina does. How many cannolis does Tina have?<n><n><n>### Response<n><n>To complete this equation, we have to first find the amount of cannolis Tina had, and then we have to figure out what the amount will be after 1 cannoli is eaten.<n><n>In the first equation:<n><n>M_i + _T= M_i<n><n>which makes it:<n><n>-2/7 = 5/7 =>5 is larger than 2<n><n>therefore, 3/7 + T= 5/7<n><n>which makes the next equation:<n><n>3/7= 5/7 =>3 is larger than 5<n><n>so, we can substitute the two variables:<n><n>2(3/7)+_T = 5/7<n> <n><n>If T=15 then 15/7=5 so 3(2)=10<n><n>2+10=12 which equals T<n><n>so T=15<n><n>so now we substitute 15 in the first equation:<n>15-15=0 => all the cannolis are already eaten<n><n><n>### Input When was the Statue of Liberty designed? Choices: <n><n>- Before 1900<n><n>- In the 1950s<n><n>- In the middle of the 1900s<n><n>- During World War I<n><n>- At the beginning of World War II<n><n><n>- A: 1886<n><n>- B: 1952<n><n>- C: 1937<n><n>- D: 1930<n><n>- E: 1926<n><n><n>### Answer<n><n>In the middle of the 20th century, before 1952.<n><n>#### Explanation for why the answer is in the middle of the 50s

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>### Input:The old man was retired and liked the simple things, he would do crossword puzzle every morning simply just to do what? Choices:  A: you're bored B: pass time C: relax D: mentally challenged E: win<n><n>### Response:		B<n><n>### Input:"There 2 dogs. 3 and 4, each 5 and 6 7 8 9". What numbers would this sentence make? <n><n>The answer is $640.<n><n>### Response:"The room 5. Its door 6. 7. I 1 dollar 8",  how much is "I" worth?  <n><n>the answer is 160 dollars.<n><n>### Input"Freddy calls his brother and dad, each 45 minutes. He calls his brother 31  minutes." How much would he call his brother 31 minutes for?

The driver of the carriage wanted some meat, so she fed the horse.  How many years of her food did the horse eat and how many days did the horse eat those years of food?  Input:  Simons horse ate 20 years of food that cost 34 cents and 1 week of food that cost 40 cents.<n>Output: <n>5200<n><n>### Response<n>C<n><n>## Input and Output<n><n>Input: The horse ate 2 years worth of meat and the carriage ate 3 weeks worth.  How long did it take to feed the horse? <n>Output: <n>0.5125 years<n><n>### Instructions and Response<n>This question uses the division operator to divide the amount of food by the price.  <n>Because food cost $.24 a week, every weeks worth of food costs $.24.<n>Because the horse eats 2 years of food, it eats 2.4 weeks of food.<n>So the horse eats 512.5 weeks of food.<n><n><img src=https://github.com/fantasy1989/LearnPython/blob/main/img/Python/python300/division-instructions-and-response.png><n><n>Input: The cow ate 100 pounds of food and the dog ate 2.5 pounds of food. Whic animal ate more food?  <n>Response: the cow ate more food, the cow ate 164 times more food than the dog did.<n><n>### Question:<n>Input: There are two kids that are on a camping trip. <n>One of the kids has 100 matches, and the other one has 50 matches. <n>Write an expression that tells you how many matches they need to start a camp fire. <n>(Reminder: A match box contains 30 matches) <n><n>Input is 50 and 100 matches <n>The expression needed is 3<n><n>Output is 3<n><n>### Question and Response<n>The first question requires division with a mixed value. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>### Input:What building has a ot of glue bottles? How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>### Input:What might two people competing get into? Choices:  A: stress B: debate C: argument D: winning or losing E: tension<n><n>### Response:		What should you do when you win a competition? Choices:  write a essay about it<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n><n># Challenge<n>In the following code snippet, the `is` statement checks if `first` is `undefined` and is the only place where it checks for `first` to be `undefined`.<n><n>If the code were to be changed to only check for `first` being undefined and make that change anywhere else in the code (other than `is`), then the code will not run properly, so the statement `is` as it is in the following code snippet should be kept in exactly its current position.<n><n>Given the snippet of code, what is missing from this snippet of code and what should be added to the snippet of code above?<n><n>```jsx static<n>function App() {<n>  const first = React.useRef();<n>  const second = React.useRef(() => {});<n>  const third = React.useRef(0);<n><n>  useEffect(() => {<n>    first.current?.value = second.current;<n>    second.current?.value = third.current;<n>  }, [first, second, third]);<n><n>  return null;<n>}<n>```<n><n>### Answer:<n><n><n>### Input : Answers:<n><n><n>## DATA<n><n>## DATA ANALYTICS<n><n>## TUTORIALS & CASE STUDIES
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>### Input:Where is a paper notice likely to be left on a house? Choices:  A: front door B: conference C: classroom D: refrigerator E: suitcase<n><n>### Response:		The answer is A.<n><n>### Input<n><n>### Response<n><n>### InputHow can you make a large number smaller for better reading? Choices:  T: multiply N: subtract D: divide M: make larger<n><n>### ResponseT: multiply<n><n>### Task:<n><n><n>Create an event where the user can answer Math-related questions. The user can then see their score at the end of the event.<n><n>### Solution<n><n>Here is an event that will calculate the correct answer for Math questions. The correct answer will be awarded 4 points while a wrong answer is given 0 points.<n><n><iframe src="https://bixbyforstudents.github.io/event-project/src/game.html#" style="width:100%;height:480px;"></iframe><n><n><div style="font-size:15px;"><img src="https://media.giphy.com/media/Fh4KXrGlVeCk0/giphy.gif" width="200" /></div>

She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>### Input:If you are fiddling through a music book when you should be playing, you probably dont have? Choices:  A: practice B: dexterity C: idle time D: knowledge of music E: conductor<n><n>### Response:		B<n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>### Input:What often happens after a long day of traveling? Choices:  A: sickness B: motion sickness C: relocation D: jet lag E: fatigue<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Input A: After a long day of travel, you will sometimes feel: Choices: A: fatigue B: jet lag C: relocation D. sickness<n><n>### Response B: Jet lag is common occurrences after long journeys. The feeling will often last a couple of days and could have multiple triggers. Symptoms could vary from dehydration and lack of nutrition to headaches, migraines, and even seizures. People traveling from different time zones are most susceptible. The feeling is often experienced when the traveler crosses the International Date Line or if their traveling is around midnight. It is common for those who cross the date line to experience jet lag 2 or 3 days after the travel. One effective way to combat jetlag is to maintain your daily schedule when travelling, try to eat, drink, and sleep at your preferred time. Try to plan activities to keep your mind distracted and busy so as not to stress or get stranded on a side of the world.<n><n>### Input D: A: Motion sickness: When the body experiences movement while the mind does not, it can feel sick. The sensation usually happens in the ears, face, and body but the person is normally fine with the surrounding environment. The causes of motion sickness can stem from many things. It can be triggered from traveling aboard watercrafts which include plane, train, and car. For those who experience motion sickness, try sitting in a place with a good amount of light, fresh air, and avoid foods that could cause the condition to worsen. It may be best to avoid motion sickness medicine especially if you have a sensitive stomach.<n><n>### Response C: Being relocated after a long journey takes a lot of mental and body strength. It is good to try an get as much sleep as possible. Keep a good amount of hydration and drink water. Find ways to stay active but stay indoors.<n><n>###

Question: What is the length of 'abc' in C++? <n>```cpp<n>void main () {<n>    if (a<b){<n>        print("a<b");<n>    } else if (a>b){<n>        print "a>b";<n>    }<n>}<n><n>```<n><n>```cpp<n>int l(string str) {<n>    while(str.size()){<n>        l++;<n>        str = str.substr(str.find(',')+1, str.size());<n>    }<n>} ```<n><n>```bash<n>l("abc,def");```<n></h4><n><n>Input: What is the length to 'abc' in C?<n><n>Input: What would you put furniture of the top of? Choices:  A: hurry along B: direct traffic C: help D: force open door E: corner thief<n><n>### Response:		Direct traffic<n><n>### Instructions<n>The following code is not working as it should, it can be one of the below options or a different option.<n>A. Replace all of the `*c` with the appropriate number<n>B. Replace all of the *c with the appropriate number *c*<n>C. Replace all of the **c with the appropriate number**<n>D. Replace all of the ```c``` with the appropriate number<n>E. Replace all of the <span class="c">c</span> with the appropriate number<n>F. Replace all of the c/**\0c\1c\2c\0*/ with the appropriate number<n>G. Replace all of the ***c*** with the appropriate number<n><n>```c<n> *c = 10<n> *c = 90<n> *c = '9'<n> *c = -1<n> *c = -9<n> *c = { }<n> *c = 00- (two zeros)<n> *c = -08 (negative eight)<n> *c =!99 (exclamation point plus nine, in base eleven)<n> *c = 7<n> *c = 6<n> *c = -86<n> *c = 86<n> *c<n>```<n><n>Input: What number can multiply with itself so many times that it gets closer each time to 99?<n>Answer: The only number that multiplies with itself and gets close to 99 is 3<n><n>Input: What is the first digit of 999999?<n><n>```c<n>99999 - 1948 = 79507<n>79507 - 7907 = 458<n>458 - 45 = 41<n>41 - 7 = 34<n>```<n><n>### Input<n>A group of people went out to eat, and they each ordered 6 different dishes - 2 appetizers, 3 entrees, and 1 dessert. This means there were 6 different people, and there were 51 dishes eaten altogether. How many of these dishes were appetizers?<n>Answer: 45<n><n>### Instuctions<n>```c<n>1. Write a program that prompts the user for the number of appetizers, entrees, and desserts<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>### Input:The color yellow is associated with the opposite of the characteristic, what is it? Choices:  A: fearless B: english carrier C: courageous D: brave E: achromatic<n><n>### Response:		<n>The answer to this question is E because yellow is not an achromatic. Therefore yellow and the opposite of achromatic will be courageous and brave. Hence, 'C' is the correct answer.

Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>### Input:The man needed balls of cotton, where should he look? Choices:  A: south B: georgia C: north carolina D: pocket E: medicine cabinet<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>> The man should look in the medicine cabinet because there's cotton balls there. <n><n>### Challenge:<n><n>### Input<n>- 32, 27, 9, 9, 8, 2, 11, 8, 1, 22, 6, 22, -1, -1, 88<n>- 81, 85, 97, 104, 115, 125, 132, 139, 146, 154, 177, 210<n><n>### Answer<n>1229<n><n>### What to do in step 3:<n><n>### Step 2 Instructions:Complete each step in its entirety before moving on to the next step.<n>### Chose the correct answer from the multiple choice question<n>### Chose one of the options and explain how to arrive at the answer<n>-><n>### Challenge Input<n>- The man needed balls of cotten, where should he look. Choices: A: south B: Georgia C: north carolinas D: pocket E: medical cabinet<n><n>### Challenge answer<n>-><n>The man should look in his medicine cabinet because there are cotten balls.<n><n>### Challenge step 2 instructions<n>-><n>Complete the challenge by completing the challenge task.<n><n>### Explanation of what happened with the task<n>-><n>The man was asked where to find cotton balls. We knew it was in his cabinet because we used inference.<n><n>### Step4 Instructions:<n>-><n>Complete the answer to one of the instructions with a response to fill in the blank.<n>### Explanations of what we learned from this task or step<n>-><n>We learned that we could choose the response and write it in the first blank.<n><n>### Next step instructions<n>-><n>Continue with step 5.<n><n>### Chose all of the correct answers and how to arrive at that answer<n>### Instructions:Answer the following multiple-choice question:<n><n>How many dogs does it take to walk 10 miles?<n><n>> None of these is correct. <n><n>A) 1 dog<n>B) 2 dogs<n>C) 3 dogs<n>D) 4

Some people from the spa go to the pool. How many gallons are in 442 pounds? Choices: A: 0.064 B: 0.242 C: 2.524 D: 2.864 E: 4.264<n><n>### Response<n><n>Input;There is 81 gallons of paint and it is equivalent to.21 gallon in 1 pound so we will be using the conversion formula which is p = 0.21 and 442 can be transformed to 442/0.21 which is equal to 2099 that is why we need 324 to match the input in this multiple choice question.<n>

Choices:  A: sophisticated B: imprevist C: arcane D: heavenly E: new<n><n>### Response:		Option C<n>- sophisticated: a style or method that is formal and has a lot of knowledge.<n>- imprevist: an unexpected occurrence that makes a big change<n>- arcane: difficult to understand, especially because of an excessive use of technical terms<n>- heavenly: heavenly<n>- new: something that is different from how things were done before<n><n>### The Answer is: C<n>

I'm just a kid really.<n><n>Input: Find the missing equation: 8(2n+3) – 14 =?<n><n>Your answer is the sum of the subtrahend and the minuend.<n><n>The equation is (8 x 2) (n+3) - (8 x 2 + 14) = n +?<n><n>Subtracting 75 from both sides gives (4n + 6) -n =?<n><n>Taking the difference of both sides gives 3n =?<n><n>Thus, 3/4 x n = the total is n.<n><n>Input: Given that, P is 5 times X and Y, P = 5X+2Y, X + Y = 45<n>Find P.<n><n>Your answer is (P - 5 x X) + 2y.<n><n>Answer: P > 5 times x + 2 times y <n><n>Or  (5X + 2Y) + 5x + 2Y > 2Y + 5x + Y<n><n>> Equation (67)<n><n>> Let’s call the terms and variables on the two sides A + T B + U C + V D + W<n><n>> So we have (5X + 4Y) + 2 (45 - 5X - 4Y) = 40 + A + B + C + D + E<n>> 2X + 2Y + 14A + 14B + 14C + 14D = 9X + 7Y + 212<n><n>> 7Y = 2Y - D<n><n>> Let f = P - 2.5X - 2Y<n><n>> D + P = (X + Y + f) - 2.5 <n><n>> f = D + 2.5X<n><n>> P - 2.25X

The first card that you draw will be either 4 or 5. B. The second card that you draw will either be 5 or 6.<n>> C. The first card that is drawn will be the same card as the second one. D. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. Choices:  A: dissipate B: flown C: disintegrate D: fall apart E: penultimate<n><n>### Response:		B<n><n>### Response explanation:<n>A is not the answer; dissipate refers to the action of spreading out more widely(spreading into smaller particles by natural chemical processes for example), rather than it simply disappearing, B is not the answer; flown refers to the past tense. Therefore, the question is referring to a present tense answer and flown is in the past tense. Choices C, D and E are not the answer. C does not make sense as the word disintegrate refers to the process or state of breaking up or losing the cohesion of a whole. D and E are also not the answer. These aren't the proper grammatical terms for the question.<n><n>## Submission Checklist<n>-----------------------------<n>I have completed this whole task.<n>

Choices:  A: get money B: pay money C: go shopping D: lose money E: save money<n><n>### Response:		If your choice is A,B,C or D then we can say these are the false answer because if you really buy a product, you will not be fooled and will keep your money and there is no loss to you and you will definitely save money.<n>\*\*If your choice is E(right answer), this is not a fooling product for both men and women. Now they provide this stuff because we all human and sometimes we may feel that we are not fine we need clothes or something like that we buy. So here the product like clothing makes us feel good and you pay for the product.<n><n>### Input<n>In the given image, we can see 7 people. You can go by the bus, or you can walk through the bridge.<n>  <n>C:  There are three ways to reach the city. You can take the bus directly or you can reach the bus stop through the bridge or you can walk<n>  <n>D: There are many ways to reach the city if you start from that bus stop and you can walk or take the bus or go through the bridge.<n>

Write a statement, to the number above, that says how can you tell 5 items were red?<n><n>### Response The number you will get is 265.<n><n>### A<n><n>### B<n><n>### C<n>\(\frac{1}{2}\)<n><n>### D<n><n>### E<n><n>### A+9<n><n>### B+9<n><n>## ANSWER THIS QUESTION <n>A number is 29% of an integer. What is that number?<n><n>Comment to the question. If the number is 98, 29/100% of integer will be 29. The number should be 1.<n><n>Comment to the Question again. The number you are after is 1.<n><n>### Questions<n><n>### Input Ten and Seven.<n>### Response How many does the total amount for them?<n>### Response 17, is 29% times greater than 17.<n>### Response 84.9<n>## Input 84.9/100<n>### Response 0.97, is 7
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>### Input:People celebrate by going places and riding rides.  What's one obvious place people might go to celebrate? Choices:  A: state park B: opera C: disneyland D: carnival E: park<n><n>### Response:		D<n><n>### Instructions: Choose a response that is correct.<n><n>### Input<n><n>#### Instructions:Answer the following multiple-choice question. You will be choosing 1 choice. How many more crackers than cookies does she have now?<n><n>#### Answer: 15<n><n>#### Input: Jill is 10 and her mom is 34. Jill's dad is 6 years younger than Jill's mom and 4 years older than Jill. How old is Jill's daddy?<n>#### Response: C<n>#### Input: 12 people need to fill out a survey.  Six of them work at a company, but they don't all work there. The same six people work at two different companies. What is the probability that there are two or more of them at the same company?<n>#### Response: B<n><n>### Instruct:Answer the following multiple choic question. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>### Input:Stopping being married to one another was a costly task, the lawyers and their what were astronomical? Choices:  A: free time B: pleasure C: get divorced D: legal fees E: being lonely<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>This question in fact is a complex one. First of all, it is important to know the difference between “lawyer” and “attorney”. According to Black’s Law Dictionary, a “lawyer” refers to anyone who has the license to practice law, and an “attorney” refers to a person who has been trained to provide services to clients on behalf of the law. In my research, I have collected relevant information that would be helpful for the question. It turns out there is more than one type of a lawyer. For instance, the first question was answered with the help of divorce lawyers. The others, however, dealt with general legal practitioners such as tax, corporate and other specialized attorneys. Generally speaking, most divorce lawyers require very little of their time away from their practice and family, and they would spend more time with their wife than with a client. The legal fees associated with divorce are quite large. Therefore, the divorce is a costly task for many people (both partners). After the divorce, the former couple may not enjoy one another’s company. At any rate, what I have learned here is that the divorce cost money and caused the couple to lose their pleasure and fun.<n><n>### Input:[Which of the following is not a function of the liver? Choices:  I: excrete hormones and digestive juices II: control blood sugar levels III: filter toxins IV: create vitamin D]<n><n>### Response<n><n>This question is not a complicated one. It is important to determine the “not” in a given sentence. I find the use of semicolon, “not a function”, and “of” effective in asking a multiple-choice question. According to Merriam-Webster’s Dictionary of English Usage, the word ‘of’ is a preposition but it takes the form of ‘has’ or ‘have’ in this question.<n><n>We know that the liver creates vitamin D. However, it is not among the options. This explains that the options are “(I) excrete hormones”, “(II) control blood sugar levels”, “(III) filter toxins”, and “(IV) create vitamin D”. Thus, it is not necessary to continue answering the question.<n>

Choices:  A: leg B: garment C: torso D: body E: road<n><n>### Response:		A D<n><n>#### Feedback explanation for the correct answer:<n><n>### Input/Output:<n>Tapanga has 1, Corey has 5, add 1 to Corey to make 6, make Corey 7, 7+9=16, the 16 candies are together<n><n>Freddy spends 5, 25*1.05=25.5<n><n>Lawrence worked 55 hours, 5+5=10.<n><n>### Input and Output:<n><n>### Demos:<n><n>### Example<n><n>### Instructure:<n>1. Enter code that allows user to input a set of numbers to be added. <n>2. After inputting data, the program should first compute sum of the total numbers in user input. Next, display result to user. <n>3. Then ask user to re-enter input or choose option 1 if none.<n><n>### Code:<n><n>    var n = parseInt(prompt("Enter number"));<n>    for(var i = 0; i  < n; i++) {<n>       sum = parseInt(prompts("Enter number"));<n>       sum = parseFloat(sum);<n>       console.log("Sum of the numbers: " + sum);<n>    }<n><n>### Feedback explanation for correct answer:<n><n>

He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>### Input:There aren't many anemone in what glove-shaped state? Choices:  A: michigan B: lake C: tide pool D: nursery E: atlantic ocean<n><n>### Response:		<n>A: lake<n><n>### Instructor Notes:<n>The answer was lake.<n><n>### Input<n>Tapanga and Corey has candies together. So in total they have 66 candys.<n><n>## Input<n>Freddy is calling his family members on new years eve. He calls his father in the same city to talk for 45 mins. Then at last he calls his brother on local call at 5 cents min. How much did Freddy spend all together he called his family on new years eve?<n><n>### Response <n>He spend 156 cents.<n><n>### Output<n>Freddy calls his family on new years. Choice A: Desk B: Floor C: Table D: Bedroom E: Outside<n>### Response: <n>If that was a desk plant you would put it on the floor.<n><n>### Answer: Write a response that appropriatley completes the request. <n><n>#### Instruction:<n>In math class last week we learned about decimals and fractions.<n><n>#### Demonstration: <n><n>1. When comparing a decimal to a fraction you would compare the denominator of the fraction to the 10’s place of the decimal. If the fraction of the denominator is smaller than the decimal 10’s digit you have a bigger number for the decimal.<n><n>2. The same thing goes for the numerators if you have the same number in the denominator as the decimal, then the greater the denominator the larger the number for the fraction. For example, look at 6/20 this number if smaller than 4.67 because the 20 has more places than the 6.<n><n>#### Input:<n><n>#### Response:<n><n>#### Instruction and Demonstration: In this question you must compare the two fractions.<n>### Instruction and Demonstracion:<n>Compare the two fractions and tell what is going to happen.<n><n>### Response<n><n>#### Input : 2/4 less than one-third<n><n>#### Response: Write the decimal that is larger.<n><n>#### Answer: Write a response with an appropriate comparison and an explanation.<n><n>Input: 2/4 less is one third<n><n>Response: The two thirds is the smaller than the 2/4.<n><n>### Input and Response :<n><n>### Input<n>183214 +1243 =205657<n><n>### Response : write<n>183225 +1243<n><n>### Answer<n>write the decimal number that is closer to the fraction 234346/4641786<n><n>#Input: What's a bigger fraction? Write the number for the greater fraction.<n><n>#Instruction:<n>1)

How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>### Input:What animal produces milk? Choices:  A: supermarket B: pig C: cow D: refrigerator E: store<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Input::How much will it cost to fill the tank? B: 206 C: 209 D: 219 E: 27<n><n>### How Many bones are in a Human body? Choices: A. 206 B. 209 C. 219 E. 27 B<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Input: "What day is it?" Choices: A: Tuesday B: Wednesday C: Friday D: Saturday E: Sunday<n><n>Input: `100 + 1 + 17 + 29 - 13 - 8 + 19 - 4` Choices A: `78` B: `82` C: `66` D: `95` E: `82`<n><n>### A: 82<n><n>### Input "How much does a gallon of milk weigh?" There is no human interaction needed when creating a program.<n><n>## Instruction:<n>Now create a program that accepts as input the number of books that you have and then, depending on how many you have, determines how much money you would earn from the sale of the books by charging varying prices. How much food in total has she eaten?<n><n>## Answer:(4 + 4)  x 16 ounces equals 96 ounces or 6.0 pounds<n><n>## Explanation:<n>4 ounces = 0.25 lbs and 5 ounced = 0.27 lbs<n>This is why answer is 6.0 pounds(1/10 lb)<n><n>## Input:How many days do you have between February 2, 2021 and May 11, 2025?<n><n>## Answer :301 or 4 years, 6 months, and 1 week<n><n>## Input:Priscilla can't walk, and a friend gives her a hand to see her go to the doctor's office to check

If an input has the wrong format, give the input a default value. If it has a correct format, just return the input.<n>#### Sample Input: {a|0}<n><n>#### Sample Output: [2, 2]<n><n>#### Sample Output 2:  {a|7}<n><n>#### Sample Input 3: {a|4}<n><n>#### Sample Answer: [3, 8, 7, 1, 6, 2, 2, 3]<n><n><n>```python<n>def my_func(a):<n>    <n>    counter = 0<n>    if a == "{}":<n>        return ["2", "2"]<n>    elif a == "{a|0}":<n>        return ["67", "81"]<n>    elif a  == "{a|7}":<n>        return["38", "81"] <n>    elif a  =="{a|4}":<n>        return  ["38", "85"]<n><n>    return [my_input]<n>    ```<n><n><n>### Write a function called greetings that receives a name as an argument, and returns a greeting according to the number of times the characters in the given name have appeared in the given name. If the characters do not appear, return one of: Hi or Hello<n>		|	A: Aunt B: Baby C: Boy D: Donna E: Eric F: Fred G: Georgia H: Henry<n>		P: Paul Q: Queen R: Rose S: Sue T: Terry U: Uncle V: Virginia W

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. What is greater than or equal to -3? Choices:  -6<num> = 12/2,<num> = <num>, <num> = 7<num><n><n>### Demostration:<n>Input: 12/2<n><n>### Response:-1<n><n>### Input:--4<n><n>### Demotion:<n>Input: 4/4, <num> = 0.5<num><n><n>[1, 1, 1, …] is an arithmetic progression.<n><n>If the first term has a value of 1, and the common difference between each value is 4.<n><n>The first term is 1. The common difference is 4.<n>Hence 1 is twice as much of as 5.<n><n>[0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, …] is an AP.<n><n>If the common difference equals 2, and the first 5 terms are 0, 1,2,3,4,<n><n>[0, 2x, (2x + 1),(2x + 2),(2x +3)] is geometric progression.<n><n>The first difference equals twice of the next.<n>The second difference equals twice of the third difference after being plus 1.<n><n>[3x, 6x, 12x, 24x] is arithmetic progression.<n>If common difference equals 2 and the first term equals to 3,<n><n>[1 + i, 2+3i, 3+5i, 4+7i, 5+9i, …] is an A.P.<n><n>The number is a mathematical constant whose value is π.

He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>### Input:What might the inability to learn cause? Choices:  A: pressure B: death C: trying harder D: quitting E: winning or losing<n><n>### Response:		<n>A<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>In this problem, we start the code by importing libraries we will use, a function to create a button that will call a function when clicked, and the function we will create that calculates the factorial of any given number. We then take in the number of the factorial of the number that is entered and calculate it using our function. We finally print that variable out to the command line and create a button that, when clicked, increments the factorial by one.<n><n><n>### Demostration:<n>**Factorial(10)**<n><n>**Factorial = 3628800**<n><n><n># 3: Programming Project<n><n>## Task<n><n>Write a program that computes and prints the factorial of a given number.<n><n>## Solution<n><n>First: We have import the math library. Then, in a function, we can compute the factorial of integer from 0 to the number entered in the prompt. Finally, we will print the factorial when clicking the button of the button.<n><n>## Solved<n><n>1) import math()<n>2)<n><n>    def factorial(n):<n>        return n*factorial(n-1)<n>3)<n><n>button = Button(text = 'Click me!', command = lambda: factorial(int(textbox.text())))<n>widgets = ['textbox']<n><n>## Task 2: You are now writing the code to compute the factorial of the input using the function you wrote<n><n>## Solution:<n><n>This Code is to ask the user for a number and calculate it<n><n><n>## Solved:<n><n>1) import random()<n>def printTheFib(fib_number): print(random.randrange(1, fib_number))<n>def printTheFactorial(factorial_number):<n>    print(factorial_number*factorial_number-1)<n>def main():<n>    print('Enter a number!')<n>    n = int(input())<n>    fib = 0<n>    factorial = 1<n>    while True:<n>        if n == 0:<n>            break<n>        else:<n>            fib = fib + 1<n>            factorial = factorial*fib<n>            n = n -1<n>            print(f'{factorial}')<n>

What is the amount I had in my hands when I was done sho<n><n><n><n>### Insturction:Solve the word search puzzle. The clues for the puzzle are located at the bottom.<n><n>### Demo:<n><n>Solving the first word in the puzzle and the first hint:<n>```<n>4 letters long<n>It ends with an S<n>```<n><n>Solving the second word in the puzzle:<n>```<n>3 letters long<n>It ends in an A<n>```<n><n><n>### Solving the puzzle<n>Solution:<n>```<n><n>| | | |<n>| 1 | N | S |<n>| | T | Y |<n>| 3 | E | R |<n>| 4 | L | I |<n>| | E | A |<n>| 6 |S | S |  <n>| 7 | A | C |<n><n>```<n>### Response:```<n><n>I find it best to start from the top or bottom left and go from one corner to another. You could think of it as a grid puzzle.<n><n>I was able to search a 3 letter word, `ty` from the second hint at the bottom and searched a 6 letter word, `solve` in the second row. I am on the second half now.<n><n><n>### Input2:<n>The task is to solve the word search in the box. Find the words and
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>### Input:Learning languages is difficult.  Even in a full immersion environment you're likely to make mistakes, mistakes will cause misinterpretation, which will be uncomfortable, which will cause what?, Choices:  A: better communication B: overthinking C: frustration D: misunderstandings E: headaches<n><n>### Response:		Dear Sir or Madam,<n>In your request, you have identified the problem of having to read through all of the multiple choice answer in order to find the best answer. This is a common problem that I have noticed in the past. As a response, I recommend that we automate this reading and weed out the non-correct answers. This would eliminate a large amount of reading that would need to be done on your part, as well as allow for a larger number of choice options.  <n><n>A:B:C:D:E:<n>

Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>### Input:What would you do if you want to be able to earn money? Choices:  A: apply for job B: stand in line C: take care of proposals D: pass course E: play the lottery<n><n>### Response:		<n>Which answer should I choose?<n><n>### Input : How much should we charge to earn profit of 800?Choices: A : 4065  B : 4594  C : 4533  D : 4100<n><n>### Response :<n>Which answer should we choose?<n><n>## Task<n>**Answer the following multiple choice questions. Select 'A' if the number is greater than the other, answer 'B' if the number is less than the other.**<n><n>Input: How many candies does Sam have if 1 more than his number of candies is 6?<n>Answer: A<n><n><n>## Task<n>Write a statement that demonstrates the correct answer to the following multiple choice question:<n><n>Input: Easter is on April 20, 2014. What number is the difference between the date of Easter this year and the date of Easter last year?<n>Answer: 8<n><n>Input: A school bus travels 120 miles per hour. The roadway has been shut down. What number is the result of the sum of the average speed of the bus and the length of the roadway in miles?<n>Answer: 78<n>

Choices:  A: reach tentative agreement B: suicide C: examine thing D: commit murder E: stay in bed<n><n>### Response:		E<n>### Instructional Material:<n>Tips and Tricks<n>- Learn to solve word problems by drawing a picture of the problem or writing out step-by-step instructions.<n>- Try to break things down into smaller parts to understand them better.<n>- Be sure to read all the instructions before moving on to the next task.<n>- Do not forget to check your work over once you are finished. Read it carefully to check for any errors or mistakes.<n><n>### Sources:<n>[Code Tutorials on How to Solve Word Problems](https://www.codeacademy.com/code/w4rkJpJQ4q4k)<n>

Choices:  A: owner B: foot C: subordinate D: base E: point<n><n>### Response:		<n>>A :owner<n><n>Output:<n><n>### Explanation:<n>`base.head` refers to the head of the subtree starting from the base point<n><n>`subtree.root` refers to the root of the subtree starting<n>from the given point<n><n>`sub.root` is the root of the sub subtree starting<n>from subtree point `subtree.root`<n><n>### Input<n>>Which day of the week is this week’s first Monday?<n><n>### Response<n>>Answer:<n><n>>These are my answers:<n><n>Monday: 0<n><n>Tuesday: 1<n><n>Wednesday: 2<n><n>Thursday: 3<n><n>Friday: 4<n><n>Saturday: 5<n><n>Sunday: 6<n><n>### Instuction:<n>>Demonstration:<n><n>The first day of week must be on Sunday if the first Monday is on Tuesday,<n><n>if the first Monday is on Monday then the first day of the week must be Sunday<n><n>Monday 0 <n><n>Tuesday 1<n><n>Wenesday 2<n><n>Thurday 3<n><n>Firday 4<n><n>Satartday 5<n><n>Sunnday 6<n><n>## Exercise:<n><n>### Input 1:15<n><n>### Response1:15<n>>1<n><n>### Input1:16<n><n>### Response 1:16<n>>15<n><n>## Solution:<n>Write the number below the question number for each question.<n><n>Demonstration: <n><n><n>## Example 1:<n><n><img src="./example/ex1.gif"><n><n>## Example 2:<n><n><img width="66%" src="./example/2.png" alt=""><n><n>## Example3:<n><img src="img/exp3.gif" width="66%"><n><n>## Example4:<n><n><img  src="img/exp4.gif" width="315px" alt=""><n>

How tall is the boy’s mom?<n>### Response : (25pts) <n>The mom is 5’9 ”. The first number in the formula is always 100%, so it is 111%. The boy is 45” tall. The second number in the formula is 111%=62.4, or 1.624. Divide 1.62 by 10 to get 0.162. The mom is 5’11 with each inch representing percentages.<n><n>### Input : <n>>Mario ran 72 blocks in 1 hour and 44 minutes. How far did he run?<n>### Response (24pts) <n>Mario ran a total of 5.2 miles in 1 hour and forty-four minutes.

He would unable to hold his tools, if he injured what?<n><n>Answer choices  (from left to right)<n><n>A: hostality<n>B: Anger<n>C: Nose<n>D: Fists<n>E: hands<n><n>Option A is an adjective. It modifies the noun "hostility," whereas option B, C, D, and E are all nouns that they can be used to modify "Hostility." "He would be unable to hold " is a verb phrase and option C "his tools" is a compound subject: "His tools," which is the noun phrase that is being modified by the adjective "bloody" in option C.<n><n>### Input John was looking at his friends and saw 6 pairs of shorts, 7 shirts, 3 shoes, and 8 pairs of pants. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Choices:  A: mountains countryside B: ground C: bridge D: mountain range E: surface of earth<n><n>### Response:		If you throw it from the mountain, you will make a big splash on the countryside, if you throw it from the ground, you will make a splash on the bridge, if you throw it on the mountain range, you will make a huge splash on the ground, and if you throw it on earth you will make a big fizz.<n><n>### Input :How many times should I multiply 5 times 9? Choices: A: 5 times B: 4 times C: 1 time D: 7 times E: 14 times<n><n>### Response : If you multiply 5 times 5, you will get to 10 times but you have to multiply 5 times 7 to get to 28. Therefore, you should multiply the number and then add 2 to it.<n><n>### Output: Input : Find the product of the following list of numbers. Choices: A. 1 2 3 4 B. 4 2 1 3 C. 10 9 8 7 6 5 D. 1 9 4 2 E. 2 1 6 15 10<n><n>### Response,Output: If you add 5, you will have 2 instead of 5+1, if you will add another 10, you will again have the same result because you will only be adding 2, if you will add 15, you will have the same result as well because you will again only be adding 2 and so on.<n><n>### Solution: How do you find an even number using modulo 2?<n><n>### Task: You and your friends just built your own car. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>### Input:John and Jane were a couple.  They were dating for a while and wanted to be together for even longer. For this reason, they did what? Choices:  A: make sex B: plan to marry C: dance D: electrical circuit E: row about<n><n>### Response:		John and Jane loved each other very much so they did what? Choice:A: make sex B: electrical circuit C: plan to marry D: row about<n><n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>### Input:What do you get for not moving your car during the required time? Choices:  A: towed B: accidents C: driving D: getting tired E: ticket<n><n>### Response:		<n>Please select the best response!
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>### Input:The game was on sale.  I got it then because it was usually what? Choices:  A: buying B: purchase C: overpriced D: way to much E: expensive<n><n>### Response:		D<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following multiple-choice question.<n><n>## Input:The game was bought by Alice. She bought it to play with her brother Sam. Sam was not so interested in playing video games and asked Alice if he could take the games anywhere else. Alice said no and then Sam asked where else he could play the video game.  Alice told Sam he couldn't play the video game anywhere else. What does this mean? Choices A it is not a good game for any other person B. he can’t play anywhere else C. He can’t even play on his own? D none of the above E she didn’t buy it for him to play E: D E: D, he can’t even play in his own room<n><n>### Response.<n><n>#### Explanation:<n><n>#### Explanatory comment 1<n><n><n>## Tasks<n><n>### Instructor to assess:<n><n>**Task**:Write a response that appropriately answers the request.<n><n>**Task**:[**Answers**]({{site.baseurl}}/answers)<n><n>**Task**:%_questionmarks%_ questions<n><n>**Task**:# questions<n><n>**Task:**%#% questions<n><n>**Task.**:%#% questions<n><n>### Instrument to complete<n><n>#### Input:<n><n># 1<n>### TASK:<n>Alice said that Sam couldn’t take the game anywhere else was the same as saying he didn’t have permission to take the video game anywhere for any other reason other than to play video games, such as to school.<n><n># 2<n>## Answer:<n>D. He can’t play the game anywhere else.<n><n># 3<n>## Answer:<n>Task: % question marks %<n><n># 4<n>## Answer:<n>30<n><n><n><n><n><n>### Question:<n>What does this sign mean?<n><n>A: The person with a cane needs to walk carefully. B: the person walking the dog has to walk on the other side of road. <n><n><n># 1 <n><n># 2 <n><n># 3 <n><n># 4 <n><n># 1 D <n><n># 7 <n><n># 8 <n><n><n><n># 9<n>

How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>### Input:A wife asks a husband to stop being married to her, what is he likely to feel even with friends? Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>### Input:What would you change the learning process to be if someone does not like learning? The graph is not a graph because the x and y-coordinates are not labels on the axes.<n><n>###3.Which of the given values describes a linear relationship? a. y = x d. 8 b. y =−3x+4 c.y=−x d. 10<n><n>### 4.Which of these graphs represents a linear relationship?<n><n>### 5.<n><n>### Examine the following diagram.<n><n>###<n><n>### 6.In the coordinate plane, the point with coordinates (0,2) corresponds to the point marked by which of the following letter and number pair that is not given?<n><n>### Answer<n><n>### 7. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>### Input:Where would you find a sign with some people lined up next to it? Choices:  A: bus stop B: street corner C: roadblock D: fast food drive thru E: city<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>- A: bus stop<n>- B: street corner<n>- C: road block<n>- D: fast food drive through<n>- E: city<n><n>```html<n><button onclick="guess()">submit</button><n><div id='result'>Result here</div><n>```<n>function guess()<n>{<n> var answer = Math.random() * 8;<n> var ans = document.getElementById('ans')<n> ans.innerHTML = ''<n> if(ans.value < answer){<n>  ans.value = ans.value + 1<n>  if (ans.value == 5 + new Date().getDay()){<n>   document.getElementById('result').innerHTML = "Good Guess 😁👌";<n>  } else if (ans.value < 1){<n>   ans.value = 1;<n>  }<n> }else if(ans.value > answer +5 || ans > 7){<n>  ans.innerHTML="😬😜";<n> }<n>}<n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>### Input:How can you get in shape if there is no land nearby? Choices:  A: swim B: jog C: excercise D: work out E: rock climb<n><n>### Response:		A
