Choices:  A: sun himself B: thank god C: race against time D: express love E: to think about things.<n><n>### Response:		D<n><n>#### Input:There are two people. Person A is taller than person B. Person B is shorter than person A's legs. How tall does person A need to be if they would form a straight line, but without touching?<n><n>### Response:"Well we have to subtract their lengths and we start with the smaller person. His leg length is 4cm so his height will be 114cm then we have to divide the height of the larger person by two and then we have to add 4cm to the total height of the bigger person. Then the two will be the same height but touching each other."<n><n>#### Input:Sam has a dog. He is the only one that takes care of the dog. What is the problem?<n><n>### Problem:Sam doesn't take care of the dog.<n>### Possible Solutions<n>- You want to take care of Sam's dog!<n>- You want you to take care of Sam.<n><n>### Sam has a dog. One day I was at his house and I came in. When I came in the dog started barking at me for coming into the house! What was the problem?<n><n>Input: Sam has a dog. Then I came into the house. and then the dog started bark for me came in to the house. When I came into the house, the dog started bark.<n><n>Output : You are Sam's dog.<n>

I want to get involved in some activity that makes me happy, relax, and feel good. My friends and I also like to sit around and share a beer or two.<n>

Choices:  A: allergic reaction B: gain weight C: have fun D: heartburn E: food poisoning<n><n>### Response:		57% of the time, people that eat a hamburger from someone they do not know get food poisoning. In this instance, food poisoning is the answer, not the hamburger.<n><n>### Input, Part 2:If the chance of having a heart attack is equal to the chance of winning the lottery, which of the following is most likely to happen?<n>A: Someone will win the lottery<n>B: Someone will have a heart attack<n>C: Someone with win the lottery and have a heart attack<n>D: Someone will have their heart attacked more likely than someone will win the lottery.<n><n>### Response, Part 2:In this case, "C" is most likely to happen. While the chance of having a health attack is the same as the chance of winning the jackpot, some people who get sick will still need to have heart surgery to survive. This is like winning the lottery, since some people who play it do not win even just once.<n><n>### Further Reading:<n>1. You can use a random number generator, a calculator, or a coin to get a random.<n>1. In the last question, the second part of the question is the first half of the answer.<n>

How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>### Input:Where would a ficus plant brighten up a room? Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. Choices: 10 20 30 40 50 If you can't answer: The clue is to make an equation and solve for the biggest common factor.<n><n>### Solution:<n>>12 is the smallest number whose 2nd square can be divided by the number 5. This was done by squaring 12, putting that in a set, the set containing 12, and the set containing 16, the number made by multiplying both sides by 2. After you did these operations, the biggest common factor, 2, was found and therefore the smaller side could be divided by the number.<n><n>### Challenge Again:<n>Which is the sum of 3, 6, 16, 47, 333 and 2431? Choices:  A: drop out of school B: ask questions C: enter school D: wash dishes E: read book<n><n>### Response:		In this task, I found a way to solve the problem:<n><n>The instructions tell us that there are 66 candies altogether. This means that Tapanga has more than Corey, since they have the same amount, but if Tapanga has more, that means that Corey has less.<n>```<n>Tapanga has 44 more than Corey,<n>8 more than Tapanga,<n>29 more than Corey<n>```<n>In the first case, Corey has 29, and in the last case it is the same to subtract 29, so the answer is 44.<n><n>The second set of instructions tells us that Freddy spends a total of 10 dollars. This means, that each call costs 0.50 and 1 min of call can be calculated by dividing the numbers. This means 10/0.5 = 20, so each call costs 20 cents<n>```<n>The first call costed 5 cents because the first call was local.<n>The second call costed 25 because it was an international call.<n>The solution is 20+20+8=48 which was the total of Freddy's cost.<n>```<n>The third set of instructions tells us to do the same amount of hours each day. If we do so, we will obtain the solution of 5 hours.<n><n>The fourth set of instructions tells us how many books were left in the Room. It means that 600 books were still not sold. This is the answer.<n><n>The fifth set of instructions tells us the amount of money that Michael makes. It states that 100 dollars were spent on the large birdhouses but the medium and the small birdhouses sold each for a dollar more so he received the equivalent of 97 dollars. This is the correct answer.<n>The sixth set of instructions gives us information about how much each of the dogs should receive. The number to the right is the multiplier, which is in this case the percentage, because the 4 would mean that there were 4 dogs. So, Cameron and Boris get 100% and 25% respectively, to receive 38 dogs in total.<n><n>The seventh set of instructions tells us  the amount of cereal in the 3 boxes. For the first box, the amount is

So the most books to give is when Rose has book 3, 4, 6, 7, 9, 11.<n><n>### In the event of an emergency, the hospital plans to evacuate the patients on each floor in accordance with the time it takes for the elevators to reach them. The hospital's elevators travel down in 5 seconds and up in 4 seconds. The hospital has two elevators on each floor. They have an 85% chance of the elevator being broken or out of service. What is the minimum floor evacuation time for the hospital to clear the patients?<n><n>### Input<n>The floors and wait times are:<n>- Floor 1 (10) -> 6<n>- Floor 2 (5) -> 3<n>- Floor 3 (5) -> 1<n>- Floor 4 (6) -> 2<n><n>### Solution<n><n>The minimum wait time for the elevator is the maximum of the evacuation time for all floors, as:<n><n>Wait time = maximum evacuation time = 6 seconds * 1/4 / 5 = 9 seconds<n><n>So the minimum time allowed for evacuation is 9 seconds.<n><n>### Fill in the blank: A ____ is something you eat after a meal.<n>- A dessert<n><n>### In

He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>### Input:He was looking for the holiday decorations and found an old box of clothes up where? Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>### Input:If I wanted to see a lizard in its natural habitat but I do not speak Spanish, where would I go? Choices:  A: utah B: south america C: new hampshire D: japan E: new mexico<n><n>### Response:		Answer: B<n><n>### Instructions:Write a response that appropriately responds to the request.<n><n><n>### [Reference Answers](https://www.washington.edu/access-advising/pdf/SAT-Math-Questions-and-Solutions_15562.pdf)<n><n><n>{% include copy-buttons.html %}<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>### Input:Sarah opened his chest and found a second heart.  Her patient might not be what? Choices:  A: istanbul B: animal C: antique shop D: human being E: bedroom<n><n>### Response:		<n>Input: Sarah opened her chest and found a 2nd heart<n>Answer: Sarah might not be a human being<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following short answer question(s).<n><n>### Short_Answer:<n>Input: A farmer had 10 horses. Some of his horses were donkeys, and a donkey was half the weight of an average horse. The farmer found out that his weight was much less than before. What was his original weight?<n>Answer: 440<n><n>Input: Samantha wants to make an igloo in the shape of a 6-digit number. She starts by building an 8-pillar igloo to represent the four leading and four trailing digits, but she doesn’t have enough blocks to build a 9 pillar igloo. What is the smallest nine-digit number that Samantha can make? (Both leading and trailing zeroes are considered.)<n><n>### Demand:<n><n>Input: You want to take $28 from your $162 paycheck so you can go out to dinner. How much you can take?<n>Answer:20<n><n>### Input2:<n><n>Input:You are thinking on how many cans you have. You have 2 oranges, you have 3 apples.You also have 2 bananas,and 4 pears.<n>Input: You have 2 or 4 oranges, you have a 4 of apples, 3 of 2 bananas and 4 pears. How many pears do you have?<n>Input:You buy 3 mangoesand 2 apples, 3 orangesand 4 pears, 3 bananas, 3 cantaloupeand 4 pineapples,1 pumpkin, 3 watermelons,11 oranges, 5 apples, 7 bananas, 6 cantaloupe,14 pineapples. How many bananas?<n>Answer: 74<n>### Comments

However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>### Input:Where do most people keep their curling iron stored? Choices:  A: lungs and diaphram B: oxygen C: abdominal muscles D: air E: open throat<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Input<n>#### Demonstraion (4)<n>Write a math lesson in the format of “how to <task>”.<n>For example: “How to Divide”<n><n>[In this question there are “In the format of” and “For example“. This indicates that there are certain types of instruction that should be structured in a certain way: “In the format of <topic>”. There may not be a pre-defined format. For example, the instruction doesn't explain how to format “write a <something> with <someone>” or something.]<n><n>#### Instruction<n>Write a response that appropriately describes how to <task>.<n><n>### Input example:Write a math lesson (in the format of “How to <task>”)<n><n>### Input 1:Write a math lessons<n>#### Demonstration (4)<n>Write an instruction that includes an image that demonstrates the correct way of completing the task.<n><n>#### Instruction example:Ask the customer to hold the handle with the hand opposite of the side with the index finger.<n><n>#### Response suggestion:Customer to hold the handle with his left hand.

Choices:  A: were thirsty B: toasting C: getting drunk D: refreshment E: celebrating<n><n>### Response:		B<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Answer the following multiple choice questions.<n><n>(A)<n><n>### Demostration:<n>1. Took a drink and cheered<n><n>---<n><n>(B)<n><n>### Demo:<n>1. Made a toast<n><n>---<n><n>### Solution:<n>![https://cdn.jam-tech.com/image/cache/news-2019-08-02-1342212691-beverage2_full.jpg](https://cdn.jammieonline.com/image/news-2020-06-25-1342456632.jpg)<n><n>### Instruct:Write a response that appropriately answers the question.<n><n><n>### What did Cameron say to Ali?<n>### Choices: A: Hi, Ali. B: I've had enough. C: Let's do this! D: I'm not sure. E: I've had it!<n><n>### Demo<n><n>"Hi, Ali. Let's go! I'm up for it." he said.<n><n><n>---<n><n><n>### Demo(3)<n>![](https://cdn3.myminimalist.com/images/2020/04/15/a-3_11.png)<n><n>---<n><n>Below is an instruction that describes an activity. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>### Input:John is getting something important.  What does this make him feel? He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Choices: 123, 982, 032, 5000<n><n>### How will you control the number of iterations that run:  By keeping a variable that counts the number of entries and looping the program until that variable reaches the second power of the number given: True By setting the number of iterations of the program to be equal to the second power of the first number: False<n><n>### Demolition - The correct answer is A.<n><n><n>### Demand: The code shown below outputs the sum of the numbers in the array. Use an array (and do not use a constant variable) and then loop around the data in the pass.  Each pass will result in an assignment like this:  sum = sum + number<n><n>### What is one way to control the number of passes this program runs: Using a variable that counts the iterations of the loop: "loopCount". This cheerfulness turned off people who expected the funeral to be what? Choices:  A: solemn B: compete C: serious D: somber E: straightforward<n><n>### Response:		The given question is a multiple choice question, and the answer options are given as: <n><n>* A –'solemn';<n>* B - ‘compete’;<n>* C - ‘serious’;<n>* D -'somber';<n>* E -'straightforward'.<n><n>The appropriate response, ‘A – ‘solemn’’ is selected from the given choices, since the ‘question’ is related to the ‘cheerfulness’ of the speakers which was ‘turned off people who expected the [fathers] funeral to be what’. Thus, the correct answer option is the one denoting [i.e., opposite to what the speakers portrayed] solemnity. <n><n>

Choices: A: 6  B: 8  C: 10 D: 5  E: 7<n><n>### Response : The only number that comes after 36 is larger than 43<n>### Instruction : Explain the reason why the answer you chose is correct.<n>### Input : You have 100 apples. If you give 1/2 to a friend and then give 1/4 away, how many apples will you now have?<n>### Response : I know that there are 100 appples left. You got 1/2 and then you got 1/4. After the 2/4, you will now have 48 apples<n>### Input : The sum of two whole numbers is 24, what are the two numbers?<n>### Response: Let’s assume that the 2 whole numbers are \(x\) and \(y\). The sum of \(x\) and \(v\) is 24. Let us write it as \(x+v\). We can say that the sum of two whole numbers \(x_+\) must be equal to 24. Therefore, \(x+4=24\). This means that \(x+4\)-4 must also be 24. We know that \(x+4\) is equal to 24, therefore \(x+4-4\) must also be equal to 20. Putting the two equations together, \(x+4-3=24-4\). Therefore, \(x=12\) and \(y=12\)<n>### Input : There are two numbers. The sum of those two numbers is 14, and one of the two numbers is 7. What number is the other?<n>### Response One possible answer is 51<n>### Instruction Incomplete Task<n>### Input : Find the number that completes the sequence. <n>10,6,3,1,<n>### Response :<n>### Input : When I added two whole numbers together, the sum is 12. When I added two other whole numbers

How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>### Input:If you socialize by having trivial conversations it is called what? How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>### Input:The shark was migrating between continents, where did biologists find it? Choices:  A: fresh water B: gulf of mexico C: open ocean D: television program E: coral reef<n><n>### Response:		<n>A.<n><n>### Explanation:<n>The shark was migrate between two continents. So, the shark is not fresh water. Sharks normally swim more than 10 kilometers (6.2 mi) a day; this is one of the reasons why the fish have evolved their shape to be as streamlined and fast as possible. This statement doesn't specify what medium the shark is migrating between, but if the answer choices aren't an ocean, and it's not on TV, then we must assume it migrated in the open ocean. Since this answer is not listed as one of the options, the option that is listed is A, which says " Open Ocean", and is not a choice. Therefor, the answer is A.<n><n><n><n>Acknowledgement:<n>- [Drexel CodeRiders 2015](http://codegolf.drexel.edu/2015/04/10/introduction-to-programming/)<n>- [DreX CodeRiders TA Notes, Introduction to Programming](https://sites.google.com/site/drexcoderiders/home)<n>- [Dreex CodeRiders TA Note, Intro to programming](https://drex-coderiders-2015.github.io/intro-programming/intro-programming.html#multiple_choice)

Choices:  A: fresh fruit B: wine press C: fruit basket D: fruit cocktail E: picnic basket<n><n>### Response:		E<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following multiple-choice question.<n><n>## Requirements:<n><n>* One output per line for each of the three input files.<n><n>## Hints:<n><n>* There will be a different hint for each of the three lines.<n><n>* It is important to think about what the different options imply for the answer.<n><n>    * It should be clear why one choice is the correct answer in the context of the question.<n><n>    * Choose your answer carefully and consider all your options.<n><n>    * Make sure you look at the context of each input file to make sure you understand the question.<n><n>## Important:<n><n>* You must format the input and output files as described in the question.<n><n>* Each line of this assignment will be judged individually.<n><n>* Every attempt should be made to ensure that your code does not print any unnecessary lines.<n><n>* This assignment may be hand-coded, or you may use a scripting language to complete the activity. Scripts will be tested for clarity.<n><n>* It's not important to know the correct answers to all three questions, but it is important to understand how to correctly solve programming problems.<n><n>### Sample Solution:<n><n>Input: Tapangha and Corey have 29 candy bars together. However, tapanga has 8 more than corey. How many candy bars does Corey have? <n><n>Answer: Corey has 29 candy bar<n><n>### Sample Program:<n>```<n>input: tapanga and corey have 29 together candy bars however tapanga has 8 candy bars more than corey.<n>    <n><n>how many candy bars does corey have?<n><n>answer: corey has 29 together cindy bars<n>```<n>### Sample Solution 2:<n><n>Input: Freddie is calling his family on Christmas Eve. He calls her dad who lives in the same town as him, and they speak for 45 minutes, then he calls his brother who lives on the other end of the world, and speaks for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5$ per minute, while international calls costs 25$ Per minute. How many dollars would Freddie spend calling his family on Christmas?<n><n>Answer: Freddie Spends 10$<n><n>###

How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>### Input:James went to the best steakhouse outside of the South.  Where is James? Choices:  A: dairy farm B: texas C: building D: michigan E: florida<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>A. James went to the best steerhouse outside of the South, he was actually in dairy farm<n><n>E. James went to the bset steakhouse outside ofthe South, he was in dairy farm.<n><n>### Input : A farmer had 22 animals on his farm.  After having seven and one half babies, he now has 33 animals. Find the babies he had so far. Choices: A: 4 B: 8 C: 15 D:21 E: 22<n><n>### Response :<n>A. He now has 33, 4+8=12 and 12+12=24.  Add 12 and 24 together, you will get 36. So 36-33 =3 which is the number of babies he had and the answer is d.<n><n>E. He added 12, you can not add 12 and 33. You would have to add 12 to 33, which is 36. 36-30=6 which is two more babies that he had.<n>

What is the difference between her salary and her gross pay?<n><n>### Response <n>To be able to determine her gross pay you add $600. You would subtract Social Security of $57 and State taxes of $17 from her gross pay of $600. The difference is $513.00.<n><n>### Response B<n><n>### Task<n>Write a response that adequately completes the instruction and follows the provided input/output format provided by the question.<n><n>## Instruction:Answer the question, and write the response in the format shown below.<n><n>## Input: What are the six major crop producing regions of the United States?<n><n>## Demonstration: Refer to the picture below to see how the information is to be organized. From the beginning, I see that only one of them have as many apples as the other one has. From one apple (3) the other one has 9.<n><n>#### 2.<n><n>**B.** Choice 2 would be the correct answer for the following reason: <n><n>From the first question it is not specified if both groups have the same things to share. From this question I conclude that they don't. You see both groups have a number or both have a fraction with a denominator. We will make an easy example; the whole group of people have different things, and they are together sharing the same thing. The things will be shared between the groups of people who have the same things. We are not sharing an apple for each person; we are sharing an apple for each group.<n><n>### Option B:<n>#### Choices<n><n>#### Option C:<n><n>#### Choices<n>

Choices:  A: front pocket B: cabinet C: purse D: chain E: piano<n><n>### Response:		<n>Choices: (A) and (E) are the correct answer. The words "keys" and "front pocket" are the same context and can mean either keychain or bunch of house keys. Since the question asks about white and black keys, it must be referring to keys that are attached to a piano keyboard. Choice (E) is the answer. The words "piano keys" and "were they attached to" are the same context. Choice (A) refers to keys on a keyboard, instead of piano keys. Choices (D), (B) or (C) are the incorrect answers.<n><n>### Input<n><n>The instructions:<n><n>* Write a program to solve this task.<n>* You must write a correct answer to the task.<n>* You may not write a program that relies on previous programming statements.<n><n>The task:<n><n>You are given an integer number, the amount of a loan that you wish to take out. Your interest rate will be between 14% and 25%.<n><n>Write a program that will calculate the interest payment you will pay after borrowing the amount on a loan, expressed in euros.<n><n>The input will be on the commandline.<n><n>The output will appear on the console.<n><n>You may use any math and string library for this purpose.<n><n>The input:<n><n>Your string array consisting of the words 'You', 'will', 'have', 'taken', and 'out' is correct<n><n>The output:<n><n>The output: the interest payment in euros<n><n>### Input and output:<n><n>The inputs:<n><n>You have an array of 6 integers that represent the days of the week.<n><n>0 on Monday 1 on Tuesday 2 on Wednesday -2 on Thursday 3 on Friday 4 on Saturday 5 on Sunday<n><n>How many ways are there to add up the numbers in the array in a way that creates a sum of 13, starting on Monday?<n><n>Monday, Tuesday and Sunday<n><n>Wednesday and Saturday (because:2 and -2)<n><n>Friday, Saturday and Sunday<n><n>The output from the commandline:<n><n>Your output is incorrect. Choices:  A: sit down B: make mistakes C: have sex D: reproduce E: excrete<n><n>### Response:		<n>If C, which is excrete, is chosen, the function could be written `excretes = excrete`. The reason for the `=` is so that we know excretes is a function that accepts a quantity and spits out a number telling us what humans do when they legs are tired. `excretes(1)` would give 44. We don't know how `excretes` works, because we will get this error upon inputting it at the REPL. >`excretes(1) Traceback (most recent call last):   File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>   File "<stdin>", line 1, in excretes TypeError: __init__() got an unexpected keyword argument '1'`<n><n><n>### Instructions: Use the function `excretes(i)` to find the 8th value in `excretes()`.<n><n>### Instructio: What would be the value of `excretes(3)` or `excretes(4)` or `excreates(5)`?<n><n>### Response 1:<n>```<n>>>> excretes(4)<n>44<n>>>> excreates(5)<n>77<n>> What does it mean to make a mistake, what does it mean that the legs are tired?<n>> What is a string? A collection of characters, or a collection of numbers?"<n><n>```<n><n>### Response to Response: 77 is not written as `excreates(e)` but rather `excretes(7)`. In programming to get a result we can add function arguments. Because we get the error when we add an argument, we did not write it correctly.<n><n>### Question: What does `excretes(6)` return?<n><n>### Answer:<n><n>```<n>>>> Excretes(6)<n>56<n>```<n>### What is the output of the program below?<n><n>### Instuctions: Write a code for the program and run the code.<n>```<n>def multiply():<n>    def multiply(a, b):<n>        return a * b # This returns the a * b<n>    return multiply<n>```<n>### Answer: The function `multiply` returns the function that multiplies the two args. It takes 2 args and returns the final number. In the end the program

Write a short response that appropriately complements the request.<n><n>Input: You can play the card game solitaire with a deck of 52 playing cards. Write a program that simulates the game of solitaire. The program should be capable of selecting the first card from the deck of cards. If the first card is already a King, the program should select the remaining Kings and display them on the screen. If your hand is a King, the program must tell you to move on to the next card. If your hand is not a King, the program may ask the user if they wish to draw another card or put a card on the pile. You should draw random numbers between 1 to 52 and you should continue doing that until either you are given to move on to the pile or until you make a King in your hand. You should always have 3 cards in your hand so that you can go through three cards in a row, if you go through all 52 cards you should repeat the same thing starting with the first card in the deck.<n><n>Input: A typical meal includes rice and beans. Roughly how many grams of rice and beans are there in 2 cups of cooked rice?<n><n>Input: A 3L container is divided into two equal parts. How many litres are each part then?<n><n>Input: The number line is used to represent each student in a school. Use this number line to represent 60 students in your school.<n><n>Input: Every student in the school makes a pencil crayon drawing to give as holiday gifts to their parents. However, many students drew the same idea. How many students in the school drew the same idea?<n><n>Input: Students were randomly given names when they were first born. There are 31 days to April. On average, how many days apart are the names of the students?<n><n>Input: You will receive a random number from a table of numbers using R. How will you find the absolute value of the number using the R package?<n><n>### Input<n>Input:<n> <n>|G|    |   |      |     |           |<n>|P|     |  | T |      |           |<n>|A|  O |
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>### Input:Where are small grapes used? Choices:  A: picnic basket B: wine press C: juice D: fruit cocktail E: kitchen<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### Input<n><n>Input: Where does Chantelle like to eat? <n><n>### Response<n>  - Choices: A: at home, B: at the cafeteria, C: at the buffet, D: the cafeteria cafeteria, E: in the dining room, F: at the grill, H: at the coffee cart, J: at the deli, K: in the hotel<n>  - Answer: G: in the school canteen<n><n>### Input 2<n>- Choices: A: D, B: E, C: B, D: C, E: A, F: J, G: B, H: F, I: K, J: E, K: H, L: I, M: J, N: L, O: M<n>- Answer: A

Please help me figure out a way to find new people, it could help the people to survive if something would happen.<n>```<n>### Response<n>```<n>Thank you for the request. The best way to ensure that people reach a place is to send them along with others. The more people there are in a group, the better chance that they reach a place. I would recommend to get more people together to send to the planet.<n>```<n><n>### Input - The question asked by AI:<n>The population of planet Alpha increases by a number that is lesser than or equal to 25% of the current population. However, the population can't decrease. What would the future population of planet Alpha be?<n>### Response - The answer to the question asked by the AI<n>Currently, there is no limit on how many people can be on the planet at any number of time. If this limitation is placed on the population, it will definitely increase as the number of people on the planet is lower than the maximum number of people.<n><n>The population of planet alpha is 420. We need to add 100 people, but we can't exceed 600. How can we add 100 more people to planet Alpha?<n>### Input - <n>Let's assume you have a group of 6 people and an additional 100 new people, what would you do?<n>### Response<n>The most effective way to increase the number of people is to have 6 more people per group and then have 100 people split into 16 groups. This will help to increase the number of 100 people to planet alpha.<n><n>### Input and Response<n>The number of people at the park increases by a number that's greater than or equal to 15% of the current number of people. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>### Input:Dan said that getting in line was the best choice because it would lead to what? Choices:  A: being ordered B: less confusion C: boredom D: standing in line E: have to wait for<n><n>### Response:		D: standing in line<n><n><n><n>### Input <n>> How much is each of your 6 socks?<n><n>### Response<n>> 25 cents<n><n><n><n>## Solution<n>###<n><n>```powershell<n><n>function CheckNums ($num1,$num2,$num3)<n>{<n>    if ($num1 -eq $num2) {return $true}<n>    elseif ($num1 -eq null) {return $num1}<n>    else {return $false}<n>}<n><n>function CheckNopsy($x)<n>{<n>    return ($x -eq $x[0])<n>}<n><n>$a=[1,3,4]<n>$y=$a-1<n>$z=[9,8,7,6]<n><n>CheckNums($a,$y)<n>CheckNopsy($z[0])<n>```<n><n>###
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>### Input:Which long saga will we be watching on tonight's program? Choices:  A: concert B: opera C: theater D: take class E: television<n><n>### Response:		<n>If there are at least two concerts:  A: concert<n><n>If there are 2 theaters and 2 concerts:  A concert<n><n>If there is no concert and 2 theatrics:  A: take class<n><n>If only 1 theatrical and no opera:  A: concert <n><n>If no operatic performances:  A: concert E: television<n><n>If one concert and no theater or opera:  A: theater<n><n>If one concert, a theatrical, and an opera:  A theatrical (and the opera).<n><n>If there are three theatricals:  A: television E: theatrical D: take class B: television Theatrical<n><n>If there are no two:  A: all of television<n><n>If two are theatricals: A: television<n><n>If there are more than three theatricals, say at least four: A: theatricals<n><n>Comment: [See the full list](https://codeforces.com/blog/entry/59498) of my exercises on the blog.<n><n>Answer: For this exercise, you simply choose which type of program you want to watch then the answer will be generated by taking the letter representing said type of program to the corresponding position of the answer field.<n><n>\begin{code}<n>    For each question:<n>        Get which type of program we want.<n><n>        Answer field:<n>                ------------|-----------|-----------<n>                ------C---|-----------|----------<n>                -----A---|----------|----------<n>                ------E---|----------|----------<<n>                -----B---|----------|----------<<<n>                ------D---|-----------||---------- ||<n>                ------------||-----------|-----------||<n>                -------------------|--------|----------<n>\end{code}<n><n>For the type of program, we can either use the letter (A-D) or the abbreviation (E-C) for the specific type of program we want to watch. Then, to determine the answer, we use this table of which letter goes to which position in the answer field.<n>The only exception is the last question where we treat C, E, and D as if they were another type of program.<n><n>Answer: Letter -> Position<n><n>A -> 0

How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>### Input:Where would you put silverware once they've dried, but you're not ready to use them. Choices:  A: table B: restaurant C: cupboard D: kitchen E: sink<n><n>### Response:		 Answer a through D.<n><n>A: B:<n><n>```<n>"Once silverware has been used it is either clean or unclean. It is unclean because it comes into contact with the food we ate. Butter, grease, and oil from our hands can mix with the detergent. And this was not good for our silverware. We use water, soap, and detergent to clean metal and plastic. But after silverware has been used they must be placed into the cupboard. Or they must be washed and sterilized to clean them. We clean our cutlery in the kitchen or sink. Butter and grease, are unclean substances that are not suitable for us to eat. If you want to prevent your dishes and cutlery from getting dirty always use different utensils for different foods. And, do not put your dishes and silverware on the floor and make sure they are thoroughly washed before they are put in the dishwasher. For silverware, use a soft cloth to wipe them dry."<n>```<n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>### Input:What is someone likely to feel after receiving a gift that is not common? The guy who came 2nd, got to his spot exactly at the same time as the guy that won. What was the prize? Choices: 1: candy bar 2: money 3: pizza 4: sneakers 5: car<n><n>### Response : The guys that won race across the playground to claim their prize, but the prize is stolen by a stranger who was hiding in a nearby shrub. The prize was a car.<n><n>### Answer: 5<n><n>### Input The man is trying to sell a bottle cap for $2, but nobody will offer him more than $1, How much profit does man want at least? Choices: 5: 1$ 10: 50 cents 50: 1 dollar 100: 2 dollars<n><n>### Response The man is trying to make at least $1, so he asks for an amount over $2. If I buy the bottle cap for $1, I will have 1 dollar of profit and I can sell the bottle cap for 2 dollars. In this case, the man will sell the bottle cap 200-times until he reaches his minimum profit.<n><n>### Choices: 2: 50 dollars 7: 4 dollars 500: 10 dollars 100:0 <n><n>### Input Which of these 2 men is taller? Choices: 2 men:  1 is taller than the other 1: they are exactly the same 5: taller 3: neither of them  <n><n>### Response They are the exact height. They are the exact same height. If they are taller than a third man, they are shorter than him.<n><n>### Response It is a trolley problem. Should the trolley driver sacrifice one to save five or sacrifice five to save one?
